actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on September 21, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. Jayapal moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Mr. Van Drew asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on September 21. Agreed to without objection.
SERGEANT-AT-ARMS
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 705 — "Resolved, that William McFarland of the State of Maryland, be, and is hereby, chosen Sergeant-at-Arms of the House of Representatives."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2872 — "To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue electronic stamps under such Act, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3371 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to complete all actions necessary for certain land to be held in restricted fee status by the Oglala Sioux Tribe and Cheyenne River Sioux Tribe, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 423
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 401).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1530 — "To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the requirement to publish disability benefit questionnaire forms of Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes."

actions-list.header: On motion that the House instruct conferees Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 205

actions-list.actionItem: The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 2670 and on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1530 as amended, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on the Houlahan motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 2670, the Chair put the question on the motion and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Houlahan demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the Houlahan motion to instruct conferees on H.R. 2670. The instructions contained in the motion seek to require the managers on the part of the House to disagree to section 716 of the House bill.
Ms. Houlahan moved that the House instruct conferees.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 704 — "Electing a Member to a certain standing committee of the House of Representatives."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Ogles to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of September 20.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Glenn Thompson to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
